The sketch consists of one face (face\\_1) and one loop (loop\\_1). Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector. Extrude the 3D sketch along the Z-axis to a depth of 0.0027 towards the normal direction and 0.0027 in the opposite normal direction, resulting in a long, thin, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. **Part 2: Cut a rectangular prism from the first part** Create a new coordinate system for part 2. Set the Euler angles to (0.0, 0.0, -90.0) and the translation vector to (0.1654, 0.0055, 0.0526). Draw the 2D sketch for part 2 on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. The sketch consists of one face (face\\_1) and one loop (loop\\_1). The loop consists of four line segments: 1. line\\_1: Start Point (0.0, 0.0), End Point (0.044, 0.0) 2. line\\_2: Start Point (0.044, 0.0), End Point (0.044, 0.044) 3. line\\_3: Start Point (0.044, 0.044), End Point (0.0, 0.044) 4. line\\_4: Start Point (0.0, 0.044), End Point (0.0, 0.0) Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.044. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector. Cut out a rectangular prism from part 1 using the scaled and transformed 3D sketch as a cutting tool. The resulting shape is a flat, pointed end added to the long, thin, rectangular prism from part 1. These instructions will result in a long, thin, rectangular object with a flat surface on one end and a pointed end on the other, as described in the final shape of the JSON.</description>
